runs.comm: length ball angled across the left-hander from over the wicket, Dunk lashes it through the covers straight up, pierces the field and they pick up three
good length, 136kph and nipping away a touch as Finch fails to connect with a booming drive... Just inside the tramlines
touch shorter and closer to off stump, Finch hops back and blocks
pitched up, around the line of off, punched back down the track and Abbott sticks out a hand to field
excellent line, straightening slightly in the channel outside off, Finch presses forwards, gets an inside edge on to pad
drifts slightly leg side but Finch gets a leading edge, loops short of mid-on and they scamper a single
short and clubbed away! Finch goes across his stumps and muscles the first boundary of the innings
banged in again, this time Finch flinches underneath it
hit on the pads, good pace, above 140 kays from de Lange, maybe a touch high and doing too much
length outside off, 143kph but Finch uses that to his advantage, just stuns a drive through extra cover for a couple
fired down the leg side and this Jack-in-the-boxes up to hit de Kock on the finger tips and run away
beaten outside off, this is up at 146kph, zips through in the channel as Finch sits back and wafts at it
just a fraction short and walloped, four more through square leg! Finch was so quick to seize on that, using the pace and flipping the ball over the infield for another boundary
squirts a single towards point
pitched up and on-driven by Finch, lovely stroke but the ball races to mid-on
slightly back of a length, angling in with the arm, Finch closes the face and tucks a couple into a gap in front of square
length ball on middle and off, Finch turns the ball off his front pad to midwicket
decent line from Abbott, 137kph, blocked back to the bowler
on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a single
overpitched, slightly wide and battered over wide long-off for six! Set the base and launched that beyond the boundary
shuffles across and whips a couple through the leg side
length ball in the channel, Finch rocks back to crash a cut shot.. straight to point. That was smoked
too full again from Parnell, crunched hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiigh into the crowd at long-on! That's the sort of stroke that makes Finch-hitting such a wonderful sight
fullish, 138kph and Finch heaves again, inside-edges on to his front pad, they pinch one
better length, skids on and deflects off the body towards backward point
fullish and on the stumps, Finch clubs this to the leg side for a couple
length, this is played a bit more delicately, into a vacant space and they come back for two
cutter from Wiese, rolls the fingers over it, Finch defends

oh, gone, shovelled to backward square leg! Finch knew what he'd done as soon as he hit it, pulling a genuine short ball straight to the fielder. The stump mic picked up his "Oh no!" as South Africa celebrated gleefully. That might change things
slightly full outside off, Watson comes forward and opens the face towards point
pitched up, full and sliding to leg, flicks the pads on its way through to de Kock who sprawls to stop it smartly
pitched up, slightly full and Dunk drives three more through the covers
leg side and flicked away for Watson's first run
short and lickety-split, beats Dunk's short-arm pull, zipping through at 146kph
pitched up, slightly wide and Dunk has to stretch to slap one down to third man
steams in, back of a length, climbing up above off stump as Watson jumps back to defend
full and tailing in on middle and leg, flicked to backward square, they take on the throw for a single with room to spare
angled in and skipping on, hitting the pad as Watson played to leg
darted with the arm towards middle and leg, Watson flicks this away for a single
tossed up, Dunk takes a couple of steps out and deposits the ball beyond the boundary, that's a shot of intent

on the attack again - but he's hit it straight into Peterson's bread basket! Really sharp catch and he squeals in celebration... Dunk didn't get to the pitch this time, the ball maybe gripped a little and hit higher up the bat, still flew pretty quickly but Peterson was alert to grab the chance
over the wicket, flat and outside off, punched into the covers
pushed through around the line of off, Maddinson comes forward and drives powerfully, straight back to the bowler
in the channel, slightly full and punched down the ground to long-on
dug in short, a touch slower, Maddinson whips it away through backward square as the man on the rope comes in
touch short, worked off the hips and this could be tight for Maddinson... but the throw from backward square is well off beam
short ball, Maddinson dances out and slaps it cross-batted through mid-on for a couple
Wiese focusing on the middle of the pitch, worked away to leg
Wiese might be a bit unfortunate here, short, slower ball, over the ducking Watson, the bounce defeats de Kock and they run an extra on the wide

or maybe that was a bit of luck, as Maddinson plays on! The extra delivery earns a wicket, another cutter from Wiese, angled across and Maddinson played the wrong line, took the inside edge and deflected down on to off stump to zing the bails
fired through, down the leg side as Watson attempts to sweep

a wicket follows a wide again, Watson ballooning a drive to extra cover running back! The ball was wider than Watson would have liked, he skipped out but made a mess of trying to smash this down the ground. It's another fast start followed by a stumble - but whose will be more damaging?
angled in and defended with a straight bat pressing forwards
on the stumps and nudged through the leg side
length ball, maybe straightening a fraction on off stump, White blocks coming forwards
flat and on off stump, White dabs short on the off side
pushed through outside off, opens the face and steers a single through point
superb shot from White, too full again from Parnell and he just leaned into this straight drive, eased it down the ground
goes back and runs a short ball to third man
back of a length, flying through outside off as Maxwell dangles his bat a little aimlessly
continues to drop short, Maxwell runs this through backward point and gets back for two
shuffles around in the crease and pulls to midwicket
hammered for another boundary, dug in at the batsman, White swivelled like a ballerina and cracked four to deep backward square
ho ho, here we go, that's a beaut of a strike down the ground, many a row into the stand! Skipped out and smashed down the ground, such a clean strike
tries to get cute now, attempting a sort of reverse paddle, loops an edge into the leg side but gets away with it
White gets the reverse away past de Kock for a single
on the stumps, taps this into the leg side
tossed up, reverse-sweep from Maxwell and the ball cannons off the bat, racing through backward point and away for four
flat and wide, Maxwell clubs it through the covers, long-off runs around the boundary to cut it off
on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
length outside off, maybe a slower ball and Maxwell is perilously close to playing on, inside-edges on to his pad
another cutter, worked away through the leg side

length ball, punched into the ground and Wiese snatches it reaching to his right, then throws down the stumps as White regains his ground... Wiese makes sure the ricochet doesn't cost a run, either. Good work
drags this short outside off, taking the pace off, White paddles one through midwicket
impudent, super flicked four from Maxwell, waiting to play the pull shot really late and directing it fine of the boundary rider
on the stumps, reverse sweep and de Kock anticipates it, taking some of the pace off
"catch!" screams Peterson as Maxwell chips down the ground, Wiese throws himself full length, trying to get his fingers under it but can't quite cling on
angled in and played back to the bowler
turned into the leg side

Maxwell whirls the arms but this is a huge top edge... superbly taken on the run by deep midwicket! Just as the match seemed to be back in Australia's court, the required rate only a run-a-ball, Maxwell has exploded all over himself. Third wicket for Peterson, equalling his T20I best
darted on off stump, White pushes a single to long-off
short ball, over the stumps, White walks to the off side and flicks it away through backward square
steams in, short of a length again, Faulkner dabs to midwicket and runs one-and-a-half
length ball outside off, driven on the up into the covers
short and down the leg side, White had walked across his stumps and can't reach with his pull - the umpire gives de Lange the doubt
slightly full, in the channel, White comes forward to punch through the covers
length ball on off stump, backs away and dabs one down to third man
dug in, punched into the covers, dot ball
short and angled across, Faulkner goes back and deflects a single down to third man
oh, that's marvellous, White picks the full delivery and swings a golf shot into the crowd at long-off, smoking stroke
skips out and punches a single through extra cover this time
banged in short, Faulkner pulls into the ground, mistimed and it rolls to midwicket
short again, sprayed across as Faulkner made room for himself, can't reach it and called wide
follows Faulkner to leg, an inside edge squirts to backward point
super shot, de Lange pitches full on leg stump and White just smuggles it away to the rope with a flick of bat
back of a length, turned short to the on side
short and straight, he's up on his toes to pull fine but the fielder has got this covered
oof, now Faulkner goes downtown! Bludgeoned off a length, a baseball slog but there's enough timber to carry it over the rope at long-on
gone this time, slogging down the ground! Maybe didn't need to try the trick twice, Faulkner falls picking out the man at long-on for a simple catch
quick and on a length in the channel, Cummins hops back correctly and raises his bat out of the way
short ball, a gimme halftracker really and White gratefully plucks four with a controlled pull behind square
whipped off the stumps to the man at backward square, bit of a scramble but they make the single
around off stump, Cummins stays back and pokes at the ball
length ball, on the stumps, dropped short into the leg side and they charge through for one more
full length, tailing in on the stumps, White clips another single to long-on
short delivery, Cummins swings a lollipop pull in the air through square leg, no one is there and they take an easy two
fullish, around off stump, White happy to push down the ground and trust his partner
angled in and worked to leg, midwicket keeps Cummins on strike
short, maybe a cutter, Cummins toe ends a pull into the ground and Wiese hares after it

got him, Wiese snaffles a leading edge! That's what South Africa need, dot balls won't win it for them, Wiese has his third wicket, he's been bowling with canny changes of pace, Cummins tried to work it to leg and only succeeded in popping the ball back to the bowler
fullish, on off stump, Abbott leans out and prods back watchfully to mid-on
slower ball, Abbott has a swish and misses - but it was just outside the tramline
slightly back of a length outside off, draws his bat inside the line
over the wicket, on a length, White closes the face and calmly tucks one through square leg
back of a length, this is quick, 144kph and searing through outside off as Abbott swings the bat wildly

short again, not a bad ball... but superbly played, ramping four fine of third man! The delivery was right over the top of the stumps but Abbott did terrifically well to use the pace and flick it to the rope, past the diving fielder
dug in, at the batsman, pulled into the ground for a comfortable single
back of a length, White nudges one more to deep midwicket
goes for the full bunger, Abbott swings hard - and smacks a bump ball back into his partner White, actually hit him on the neck as he tried to duck. More importantly, it was a dot ball
pitched up, White plays away from his body, gets an inside edge on to pad, looked for a moment like he had played on
full and wide and Abbott has a swing and a miss

slips in the yorker, Abbott, S is hit on the boot and Abbott, K has the wicket! Up goes the finger, gets the decision even if it looked a touch leg side... Australia are eight down and still need two to win

pitched up outside off, Boyce drives behind square, into the ground but straight to the fielder, White calls him through - would have been out with a direct hit but Peterson's throw misses! Scores are level

full bunger in the blockhole, White chops it away to midwicket, it's not taken cleanly and he's off, charging through for the winning run - Australia win by two wickets with one last itty-bitty ball to spare!
